channel.title: .dat ---> c4d / 3ds max
channel.description:
Ok guys,
I've bin googling my ass off but haven't succeeded in what I'm looking for. What I am looking for is a method to convert .dat rs models to Cinema 4d or 3ds max where I will be rigging and animating. I got so far where I got a couple of dat files which I converted to .mqo. Only problem is that .mqo isn't supported by c4d nor 3dsmax. If there's someone who could send me in the right direction, thanks a lot.
Grippa,

item.title: .dat ---> c4d / 3ds max
item.dc:creator: @Timberpig1 Timberpig.
item.description:
@Timberpig1 wrote:

shrogg you use meta?? i think you should move on to more advanced programs because theres so much more they can offer.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @grippa grippa
item.description:
@grippa wrote:

Thanks alot guys

I couldn’t find the ‘‘cj’’ tutorial so I got a key of my own, if anyone wants it feel free to pm me.

Read full topic

item.title: .dat ---> c4d / 3ds max
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

you need to register meta before you can export to .3ds

Read full topic

item.title: .dat ---> c4d / 3ds max
item.dc:creator: @h1_sk1ller h1 sk1ller
item.description:
@h1_sk1ller wrote:

Yes, meta can export to .3ds, .c4d and alot of others like .obj too.

Read full topic

item.title: .dat ---> c4d / 3ds max
item.dc:creator: @Timberpig1 Timberpig.
item.description:
@Timberpig1 wrote:

if im not mistaken, meta can export c4d and max. not to sure about max, but im pretty sure about c4d.
use dat maker to export a .mgo file and export it to a c4d in meta. and vwala! (how the hell do you spell that?!?!?) haha

Read full topic

What I am looking for is a method to convert .dat rs models to Cinema 4d or 3ds max where I will be rigging and animating. I got so far where I got a couple of dat files which I converted to .mqo.
